moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Nf6 3. Nf3 e6 4. d4: One of the classics answers to the Icelandic: ignore it.
moves.4... exd5: I do my job, and we are in a symmetric position.
moves.6. Bg5: Mimicyng me. I'm looking for something to unbalace the game.
moves.7. O-O: Threatening, of course, Re1. No problem.
moves.7... Be7: Lsb is fine here. In the future will come c5.
moves.8. Qd2: That gave me an idea. I can take advantage of BxN inmediately, but maybe he is planning to take advantage of this column. Not so easy. I have another trick in my sleeve.
moves.8... Ne4: BxN, dxB, and Ne5 is not possible due to NxN (d4 is pinned to the WQ).
moves.9. Bxe4 dxe4 10. Bxe7: White saw it, and counterattacks. To keep the previous threat, I should play NxB, but then, Re1 is very strong. If f5?, Qg5+
moves.11. Ne5: Ng5 looks bad after f5 (now possible) or h6. True white still has Re1.
moves.12. Qf4: Interesting! White is winning back his piece with subtleties. Here, Nf3+, gxN, Bxc3 assures black a strong bind on the white king. g5 is not enough against Qg3, and nothing changes. Be2, Re1 just helps my opponent, so...
moves.12... f5: QxN was advisable, but black will have a better position.
moves.13. dxe5: I am fearing h3, followed by Qxf5.
moves.13... g5: Infantry attack. It must get something!
moves.14. Qd2: I can take the pawn, but... I still can, later.
moves.14... f4: Probably I must have played Rd8 at once.
moves.15... Qc5+ 16. Kh1 exf3 17. gxf3 Bf5: Not really to threathen c2, but to try to open the g column.
moves.20. Qe2: Rg1 was called for. This was a loss of tempo, but the position is already complicated.
moves.20... g4: Decisive move? Rg1 is on its way, but also is Kf7 (strenghtening Rg8).
moves.21. fxg4: Big mistake, to open the white diagonal!
moves.21... Rxg4: If Bxg5, the WQ just slips away.
moves.22... Qc6: White should try to exchange pieces, but now he has to unpin the N. Rf3 was ok.
moves.23. h3: This is the "problem-like" position. What would you have played?
moves.25... Rg3: Here! Very interesting and nice secondary key.
moves.26. Rf2: f2 will become the safest square for the K... What else can one suggest to white?
moves.26... Rxh3+: ...and my opponent resigns, in sight of R/Qh1#. Nevertheless, a good fight.
